result.execSummary:
The defendant Landon Wayne Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Landon Wayne Wilson
parties.address: 20 N. 1st St., Black River Falls, WI 54615

parties.name: Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition the Court for early discharge after 4 years if agent supports request.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to maintain employment in an occupation suitable to agent.
Defendant may apply to the Court for expungement upon successful completion of probation and he has no new arrests/charges.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended if the one he has already completed is not sufficient.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and take exactly as directed to be taken.

No drug paraphernalia.

Not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Defendant to write appropriate letters of apology to his brother and to Cody Vian within 30 days.

Defendant to submit DNA sample; not ordered to pay DNA surcharge.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment.  Employment must be in an occupation acceptable to agent.  Not voluntarily quit employment without agent approval.

No contact with M.R. or her residence, but may have third party contact for child exchange per agent.

Obey all rules and conditions established by agent.

Obtain housing acceptable to agent.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medication exactly as prescribed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages.  No entering bars, taverns or liquor stores.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
